title: The Trip
notes: Cracking. The sheer novelty of difference sounds and cadences also put the icing on the cake for me.

title: Black Christmas
notes: Not really my thing - Might be a 70s thing that the most sympathetic character was the put upon police lieutenant.

title: Wrath of Man
notes: Jason Statham in a film with classy pretentions complete with the now ubiquitous ominous long bow sound track that everyone goes for. Soft sport for Holt Mcallany.

title: ZZ Top: That Little Ol' Band From Texas
The Lighthouse
notes: Intense. Bonkers. Impressive. and that's just Willem Dafoe.

title: White Boy
notes: A real head shaker on how so many people were in on screwing this guy.

title: Ronnie Coleman: The King
notes: Pretty standard no real drama and a bit long, but Ronnie comes over as a lovely guy and you wish him well.

title: Portrait of a Lady on Fire
The Harder They Fall
notes: Difficult to see how this could go wrong with such a great cast, and Regina King was the star for me.

title: Inside Job
notes: Steal money, use that money to buy influence to make stealing money in that particular way legal. Keep money.

title: Prince of Darkness
notes: Once I got past some of the distractingly average effects - which I'm sure weren't state of the art, even in 1987, it was pretty enjoyable. I can't help thinking a toe up the arse rather than a rugby tackle would've done the trick.

title: Castles in the Sky
notes: Like that Eddie Izzard looks like Herr Flick in the poster.

title: The Crime of the Century
notes: How do these people sleep at night? Mind- blowing.

title: The Witch
notes: Atmospheric, compelling and thoughtful.

title: The Killers
notes: What a noir should be all about. Burt Lancaster has some subtlety - not something you'd normally associate with him - we rarely see 'the Grin' here.

title: The Guilty
notes: “Broken people save broken people” ooof. Loses a star right there- and it doesn't have many to play with.

title: The Guilty
notes: I had to watch this before I watched the remake, so now am intrigued how they'll compare.

title: Thief
notes: James Caan building on his rep. Want a edgy, cool and nihilistic lead? He was your guy. Special mention for the music, until it went all power ballad at the end. and big shout out to the 80s version of aviators that everyone seemed to wear - smoky tints and all.

title: Malcolm X
notes: So much to admire here. What surprised me what the verve that it started with, going beyond a by the numbers bio pic.
Wears it's war movie tropes lightly, which is hard to do.

title: Destroyer
notes: Big fan of Nicole Kidman, and she's strong enough to carry it but there were a few too many times where it dragged especially when it seemed like the momentum was picking up.

title: I Remember You
notes: the spectacular Icelandic scenery provides some ready made aura. Throw in some ethereal Nordic vibes and this was good.

title: Come to Daddy
notes: Well I wasn't expecting that.

title: On the Basis of Sex
notes: Standard legal procedural. Complete with sweeping orchestra at all the rights bits, and the inspirational clinching argument. But well executed. Nice easy Sunday night watch.

title: Once Upon a Time… in Hollywood
